stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Bubble
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Mar 19
[Race] Cerato
[Height] 135cm
[Infection Status] 
Confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Excellent
[Tactical Acumen] Normal
[Combat Skill] Flawed
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

A young warrior girl from a tribe of Sargon Ceratos, she is inexperienced, with no knowledge of the norms and customs for interacting with others. Her father sent her to Rhodes Island, ostensibly for 'training,' but actually to treat her Oripathy. 
She uses a massive shield as a weapon, relying on charging and bashing tactics. She needs Rhodes Island training to ensure she doesn't make any catastrophic mistakes in actual combat.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 2%
Her left leg shows clear signs of infection. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.24u/L
Infection remains mild, but the patient is often uncooperative with treatment, and there is a possibility her situation could worsen. 

'I hope we don't get too many more difficult patients like her...'

Bubble is the daughter of a Sargon tribal warrior. Our operators made some arrangements with her father before she came to Rhodes Island. We understand she suffered direct contact with Originium while playing in the wilderness, and failure to quickly clean the wound resulted in an irreversible infection. Bubble's father asked that we accept her for treatment, but so as not to embarrass her, he requested that we register her as a reserve operator and note her purpose at Rhodes Island as 'special training.' After her tests, she became a reserve operator.

Bubble makes a lot of trouble for the adults around her, but she's exceedingly popular among children. She is playful, principled, and particularly good at embellishing her 'adventures,' which never fail to draw the kids in for a listen. Even the clever children who know her stories are exaggerated still enjoy listening to Bubble, because those stories are indeed very well-told. 
Bubble has lots of friends, but she is closest to Ceobe. The two hit it off from the first time they met, and one always goes looking for the other whenever she has free time. As for what they talk about, it's what kids always love to talk about: 
'My favorite hero could beat up your favorite hero.' 
Bubble doesn't like to study, but that hasn't kept her from learning all kinds of new phrases, techniques, and rhetorical flourishes to describe her own father during her talks with Ceobe. But the funny thing is that no matter how much vocabulary they prepare beforehand, their arguments always descend into: 'I'm big!' 'I'm bigger!' 'I'm way bigger!' Punctuated with exaggerated gestures, such confrontations can last an entire afternoon.  
I suppose that's just how kids are. 
Looks like they're having fun.

Bubble has not yet grown accustomed to the cramped quarters of Rhodes Island. She is used to life on the wide open plains of Sargon, running across the vast prairies of the wilderness. So when she first came to Rhodes Island, Bubble had an instinctive rejection of the environment. And one way she acted out against our environment was to rampage through the ship, wrecking things. 
Don't underestimate Bubble because of her size. She's trampled robots, crashed through security doors, broken down partition walls, and never once injured herself. Should you ever see her preparing to break into a run, stop her immediately and bring her to the nearest treadmill. Or toss her into the training room, which is the safest and most effective way to deal with a 'Bubble Crisis.' 
Bubble also likes to run around the battlefield during combat. Thanks to her man-sized spiked shield, she is impervious to any threat she can charge straight through. But she tends not to consider that she could still be attacked from the side or the rear, and it is necessary to have other operators cover her. Until she is able to fully comply with dispatch or complete her Defender examination, her deployments will be limited to lower threat missions.

As the daughter of a tribal warrior, Bubble is used to the expectation that she will be a warrior just like her father. Because of her bottomless respect for her father, Bubble has been working to emulate him since she was small. But we have to ask: is Bubble really suited to that kind of life? 
When other children in the tribe were learning the importance of combat skills, Bubble was rushing around, charging into things. She has far more strength and endurance than children of her same cohort, but combat prowess is more than just strength. In the words of her father: 'This girl will not be a warrior.' 
It is perhaps because he recognized this that her father did not permit Bubble to conceal her wounds and carry on with her life, and instead sent her away from the tribe, away from Sargon, and off to a new future of her own making. 
'At least here, she can have a happy life.' It's hard to imagine such words came from a fierce tribal Cerato warrior, his body well over two meters tall covered head to toe in tattoos and totems. Not long after that conversation, our newly arrived Bubble came crashing through the reception room door. Her father apologized profusely to the operator on duty, all the while holding the crying Bubble by her ear. An hour later, after the operator saw off Bubble's father, the young girl helped herself to a snack: the leaves of our potted plant. 
It seems Bubble has a lot of growing up to do.

All our Medic Operators know the futility of trying to get control of a grumpy Bubble. Putting a stop to a charging Cerato is like stopping a hulk of agricultural machinery with a brick on its accelerator.  
But Gavial has done it. 
Not only can Gavial get Bubble under control, but she has no trouble administering injections to the girl. After attempting to resist Gavial several times, to no avail, Bubble has resigned herself to her fate. 
Subsequently, Bubble came to understand Gavial's 'glorious accomplishments' and has since come to worship her. 
And Bubble has been more amenable of late. 
Thanks, Gavial! 
What's more, Bubble has started studying some close combat techniques. When asked why, she replied: 
'I want to pound Kay flat!' 
We know that when Bubble and Ceobe get into one of their 'My Papa could beat up Vulcan' sessions, they sometimes get too into it and the conflict turns physical. They have never drawn weapons and do not escalate beyond shoving. 
In terms of raw power, Bubble is a bit stronger than Ceobe, but Ceobe's extensive experience and conditioned reflexes always put Bubble at a disadvantage, and the noisy little firecracker usually finds herself overwhelmed.  
So Bubble started training. And property damage due to Bubble has also enjoyed a significant reduction. 
Maybe it won't be long before we can declare 'Bubble Crises' a thing of the past.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

skills.desc: Stops attacking; DEF <@ba.vup>+{def:0%}</> and increase the likelihood of being targeted by enemy attacks. When attacked, deal <@ba.vup>{atk_scale:0%}</> DEF as physical damage to the target

modules.desc:
Operator Bubble has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for preservation of the front and resilience against the enemy.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Defender Operator during field operations to exercise Protector responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Bubble is in a horrible mood.
Just recently, she was watching the new animated film The Three Little Musketeers with some friends her age. Each of the heroes, seemingly just as young as them, had a shiny and glowy Originium blade and could use super-awesome techniques that made the whole screen flicker and shine like crazy, and it got everyone watching all pumped up. But then Shamare, who's always so cold, was there all alone like 'that sword's obviously just a toy' like she didn't get the mood at all.
Bubble wasn't one to say much about weapons, really. Swords were all light and fragile, and they'd never beat the cool stuff like giant axes and hammers.
But when she saw the friends she'd watched the film with get together one day and bring swords out, that really drove her nuts.
They were just like the ones in the movie! The shininess, the little button, and the dashing-ness that exuded from her friends when they lifted their swords to the air and yelled out the super-awesome move name.
And like that, a need to HAVE overtook Bubble's heart.
She couldn't steal anyone's—she'd been scolded enough times already for that—but she had no idea how she'd get one like that for herself.
By buying it? How? From who? With what? She didn't even know how many rooms were inside this metal plate box, not to mention her friends were telling her they got shipped in from Kazimierz and she can't buy one now.
Why can't Bubble get the thing she wants?! It was all her mind could dwell on, but here she is now, and she doesn't know anything, except that aside from stealing someone else's she's got no way of getting the toy. But the lessons she's been having lately, and the sense of morals educated into her, stifle her urge to snatch one.
So now Bubble can only storm around in a huff, carelessly knocking into things and yelling loudly to vent her discontent. On occasion, when she tuckers herself out, she hides away in her dorm, crying as she hugs her tribe's totem.
This helplessness weighs down on Bubble very, very hard.
Morte tastes this morsel and shares it with Shamare. After getting the rough gist of things, Shamare seeks out a psychological consultant operator at Medical, and very soon thereafter, a message is sent from HR out to Sargon...
Today is Bubble's annual 'See Papa Day,' in which her father has agreed to come visit her once a year. It's the most important day of the year to her (aside from her birthday), and Bubble forces herself to shape up and look strong, to meet Papa with a smile. Even still, once she sees him, the gloom in her heart all spills out as tears, and she can't even put her words together properly, only lie in her Papa's arms and cry away.
After the tears are done, she jumps out of her Papa's embrace, and sits silently on the couch again. And surprise! From his rucksack, her father pulls out a toy sword.
It's in this instant that Bubble's eyes shine like stars.

voice_lines.voiceText: Let's see what goodies the Doctor hides in this drawer.
I'm probably only about as big as one of Papa's legs right now. But one day, I'm gonna be as big as him, and then I'll trample all over the bad guys! Graaagh!
I'm really, really sorry! I won't run in the hallways ever again!
Fighting is super easy. I point my shield one way, and nobody can beat me. Huh? What if they get behind me? Ohyeaah... I never thought of that!
Gavial? Never heard of her. She's tough? She's famous in Sargon? Okay, whatever. I'll see for myself how tough she is.
Oh, you're talking about Gavial? I'm Gavial's number one fan. See, she even signed my shield for me. That's her autograph! I think pretty much nobody could take down Gavial, besides Papa.

Doctor, shhh, tell me the truth. Kay says Vulcan can hammer straight through the floor, can she? No? Phew... Hehe. I knew it. That means my Papa is definitely stronger. He could bust down a Rhodes smoke stack with one punch.
Do I really have to write it in the notebook...? Fine... 'I knocked over Lancet-2 today. I won't do it again.'
This is my shield. It'll be one of my greaves someday, or maybe a pauldron. Then as long as I'm standing behind you, hehe, nobody'll ever bully you.
Doctor, wake up! Someone's here to see you.

You're the boss of this training camp? And they call you the Doctor? Hrmmmm... But you don't look strong... Whatever. I'm Bubble. I may be the weakest in my tribe right now, but you're gonna train me until I'm the second strongest.
Fight! Fight! Fiiiiiight! What, why'd they stop. Is it over?
A reward for my training? Great! I can't eat it? Grrr...
I think I got a good chance of beating Kay now! Okay, lemme at her. Doctor, you can come watch!
Be good? I'll try.
I'll count down and we charge on one, okay?
Chaaarge!
Waaar!
I got this.
Haha!
Get the bad guys!
Shield up!
Traaaaaample!
Baaaaash!
Spike striiiike!
Bam!
Doctor, if you got your body as strong as your brain, you could be an awesome warrior like my Papa!
What did I tell you? I'm super strong.
Huh? Some of them got away? Did I let them through?
We can't beat them! Whatdowedo?! Whatdowedo?!
I need a way, waaay bigger room. How can anyone live in a little place like this?
Hey, that tickles.
Doctor, let's play hide-and-seek!
Arknights.
It's New Year's! We got the day off! No homework! That means it's time to challenge Kay! Doctor, you can't just sit there all day. Why don't you come wrestle with us? It'll be fun!
Doctor!
Happy birthday, Doctor! Oh, this means you've grown a whole extra year! When am I gonna get as big as you?

I have to train hard at Rhodes Island! First, I'm gonna get tougher than Kay, then I'll beat Gavial, until I finally outdo Vulcan! Then I can go back home and be a warrior as great as Papa...! Doctor, are you gonna miss me when I'm gone?

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to a Factory, capacity limit <@cc.vup>+10</> and Morale consumed per hour <@cc.vup>-0.25</>

When this Operator is assigned to a Factory, increases the productivity of Operators in that Factory based upon their increased capacity limit. Operators with <@cc.vup>16</> or less increased capacity limit gain <@cc.vup>1%</> productivity; Operators with greater than <@cc.vup>16</> increased capacity limit gain <@cc.vup>3%</> productivity (This effect does not stack with <$cc.m.var1><@cc.rem>Recycling</></> and takes priority over it).
